item.description:
Led by distinguished professionals, this six-session course traces Boston’s topography and architecture from 1630 to the present. Held in the newly opened Atlantic Wharf building, the lectures are open to the public, and serve as a portion of the training program for new volunteer tour guides.

April 7 Colonial Boston
Frederic Detwiller, AIA, Preservation Planner, New England Landmarks

April 14 Federal Boston
Dr. Judy Neiswander, Advocacy Coordinator at the Boston Preservation Alliance

April 21 Victorian Boston
Edward W. Gordon, President, Victorian Society in America, New England Chapter

April 28 Contemporary Boston
David Fixler, FAIA LEED AP, Principal, EYP Architecture & Engineering

May 5 Subterranean Boston
James Lambrechts, P.E., Professor, Wentworth Institute of Technology

May 12 Guide Exam and Certification Tour

Tuition: $95 for entire training program for volunteer guides, $35 for individual lectures. Scholarships are available for guides-in-training; please inquire for details! Morning sessions start at 10:00 am. Advance registration required. For more information, contact: Boston By Foot, Inc, 617-367-2345 or visit: www.bostonbyfoot.org.
item.how_to_find_us: Lectures are held on the second floor of Atlantic Wharf, 290 Congress Street (one block form South Station)
item.name: Spring Lecture and Guide Training Series
